title: GST Council hikes tax on used, old EV cars by businesses; Opposition reacts - Hindustan Times
summary:
GST Council hikes tax on used, old EV cars by businesses; Opposition reacts

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Goods and Services Tax (GST) Council, led by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, has approved an increase of the tax rate on used electric vehicles sold by businesses from 12% to 18%. This decision aims to align used EV tax rates with those of non-electric vehicles.

  • The tax applies only to the margin value of sales by businesses.
  • Individual sellers remain exempt from this tax.
  • The decision faced criticism from opposition leaders, asserting it's unfavorable to the middle class.
  • Arvind Kejriwal criticized the move, stating it damages the aspirations of middle-class families.
  • Akhilesh Yadav accused the government of creating an uncertain business environment with frequent GST changes.
“Purchasing a car is a big deal for an ordinary middle-class family, but the central government is crushing their dreams...” - Arvind Kejriwal

The GST Council's decision reflects a broader strategy to regulate the used electric vehicle market in India, impacting businesses significantly while continuing to shield individual transactions.
newTitle: GST Council Increases Tax on Used Electric Vehicles; Opposition Responds

title: When PM Modi Fulfilled A Special Request From 101-Year-Old IFS Officer’s Kin In Kuwait - News18
summary:
PM Modi Meets 101-Year-Old IFS Officer in Kuwait

Date: December 22, 2024 Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi held an emotional meeting with 101-year-old IFS officer Mangal Sain Handa in Kuwait, after a request from Handa's family. The interaction was warmly received by the family and showcased the Prime Minister's engagement with the Indian diaspora.

  • Mangal Sain Handa served in various countries throughout his career, including Iraq, Kuwait, and China.
  • His granddaughter expressed gratitude to PM Modi for accommodating the meeting on social media.
  • The event highlighted Modi's connection with the common people through social media interactions.
  • Handa's family expressed deep appreciation for the Prime Minister's gesture.
“You’ve won our hearts once again…Mangal Sain Handa is overjoyed, and his smile means the world to us.” - Shreya Juneja

This encounter reflects PM Modi's ongoing effort to connect with people at a personal level while utilizing social media effectively.
newTitle: PM Modi Meets 101-Year-Old IFS Officer in Kuwait

title: Maharashtra portfolio allocation: Devendra Fadnavis keeps home, Ajit finance, Shinde urban development, g - The Times of India
summary:
Maharashtra portfolio allocation: Fadnavis retains home ministry, Ajit retains finance

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The recent allocation of portfolios in Maharashtra sees Devendra Fadnavis retaining the important home ministry, while Ajit Pawar takes over the finance department. Eknath Shinde has been assigned urban development, and the housing portfolio is also a crucial part of the new allocations.

  • Devendra Fadnavis remains the home minister.
  • Ajit Pawar has been given the finance portfolio.
  • Eknath Shinde is responsible for urban development.
  • The housing portfolio is now with Fadnavis.
“This allocation is essential for maintaining stability in the government and addressing the needs of the people.”

This allocation is set to impact the governance and service delivery in Maharashtra as the state navigates various challenges ahead.
newTitle: Maharashtra portfolio allocation: Fadnavis retains home ministry, Ajit retains finance

title: Punjab civic polls: AAP wins in Patiala, leads in Jalandhar, Ludhiana; Congress ahead in Amritsar, Phagwara - The Hindu
summary:
Punjab civic polls: AAP wins in Patiala, leads in Jalandhar, Ludhiana; Congress ahead in Amritsar, Phagwara

Published: December 22, 2024, Source: The Hindu

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) emerged victorious in the Punjab municipal elections, winning Patiala and leading in Ludhiana and Jalandhar, while the Congress party held an advantage in Amritsar and Phagwara.

  • AAP won 43 out of 53 wards in Patiala and is set to elect its mayor.
  • In Ludhiana, AAP secured 42 out of 95 wards, while Congress won 29 wards.
  • AAP led in Jalandhar with 39 out of 85 wards, compared to Congress's 24 and BJP's 19.
  • Congress claimed 40 wards in Amritsar, leaving AAP with 28.
  • In Phagwara, Congress won 22 wards, emerging as the largest party.
  • AAP President Aman Arora claimed historic success, noting a win in over 50% of the 977 contested wards.
“This resounding victory is a testament to AAP's pro-people governance and commitment to transparent politics,” said AAP President Aman Arora.

The elections took place amid allegations of fake votes and opposition claims of electoral misconduct.
newTitle: AAP Wins Punjab Municipal Elections; Congress Leads in Key Areas

  • Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde receives Urban Development and Housing portfolios.
  • Ajit Pawar, NCP chief and Deputy Chief Minister, is assigned Finance and Planning.
  • Comprehensive list of ministers and their respective portfolios released.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

Overall, this portfolio allocation is essential in shaping the governance structure of Maharashtra under Fadnavis's leadership.

title: Delayed Exams, Holiday: Students Behind Bomb Threats To 3 Delhi Schools, Say Cops - NDTV
summary:
Students Behind Bomb Threats to Three Delhi Schools, Police Say

Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

The Delhi Police have identified that bomb threats sent to three schools were orchestrated by the students themselves, who sought to postpone exams. The police have conducted counseling and warned the parents of the involved students.

  • Three Delhi schools received bomb threat emails linked to their own students.
  • The students sent the emails to postpone exams after a recent explosion in Rohini.
  • The police declared the threats as hoaxes after investigations.
  • Over 100 bomb threats have targeted Delhi schools in the past 11 days.
“The emails were sent through a VPN, making it difficult to trace the perpetrators.”

This situation highlights a concerning trend of students resorting to bomb threats as a means of manipulating school schedules.
newTitle: Students Behind Bomb Threats to Three Delhi Schools, Police Say

title: GST council explains difference in tax rates between salted and caramel popcorn - Hindustan Times
summary:
GST Council Clarifies Tax Rates for Salted and Caramel Popcorn

Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The GST Council has issued a clarification on the tax rates applicable to different types of popcorn, specifying that pre-packed salted popcorn will incur a lower tax rate than caramelized popcorn.

  • Pre-packed, labelled, ready-to-eat snacks are taxed at 12%.
  • Caramelized popcorn falls under a higher tax category at 18% due to its added sugar content.
  • The Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) will release a circular to clarify these rules further.
  • Ready-to-eat popcorn not pre-packed has a 5% GST rate.
  • Black pepper and raisins supplied directly by farmers are exempt from GST.
“Salted, caramelised, plain popcorn is being sold as namkeen in certain states. Caramelised popcorn comes with added sugar, so the treatment rate is different from namkeen.” - Nirmala Sitharaman

The GST Council continues to review other tax issues without making definitive decisions, highlighting ongoing discussions about the applicability of GST on food delivery services.
newTitle: GST Council Clarifies Tax Rates for Salted and Caramel Popcorn

title: PM Modi meets 101-year-old ex-IFS officer in Kuwait after granddaughter's request - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Modi Meets 101-Year-Old Ex-IFS Officer in Kuwait Following Granddaughter's Request

Date: Dec 21, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi met a 101-year-old former Indian Foreign Service (IFS) officer in Kuwait after a request from his granddaughter made on social media.

  • PM Modi responded to a request from Mangal Sain Handa's granddaughter on platform X for a meeting during his visit.
  • This visit marks the first by an Indian PM to Kuwait in 43 years.
  • Mangal Sain Handa's son expressed gratitude for the meeting, describing it as an "experience of a lifetime."
  • Kuwait's Indian diaspora constitutes 21% of the population, with Indian workers making up 30% of the workforce.
“We deeply value the historical connection with Kuwait that has been nurtured over generations.” - PM Modi

This personal meeting highlights the relationship between India and Kuwait, especially within the context of a substantial Indian community in the Gulf state.
newTitle: PM Modi Meets 101-Year-Old Ex-IFS Officer in Kuwait Following Granddaughter's Request

title: Telangana not to allow benefit shows of movies.. - Greatandhra
summary:
Telangana Bans Benefit Shows and Actor Theatre Visits Following Stampede Incident

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: [Insert Source]

In response to a tragic stampede during the premiere of "Pushpa 2" in Hyderabad, the Telangana government has announced a ban on actor visits to theatres and benefit shows for upcoming movie releases.

  • The government, led by Cinematography Minister Komatireddy Venkat Reddy, will not allow actor visits and benefit shows.
  • While they are suspending these events, they will continue to offer special incentives for the film industry.
  • After the incident that resulted in a death and injuries, the state will not increase cinema ticket prices but will consider them on a case-by-case basis.
  • Actor Allu Arjun did not meet the family of the deceased and was criticized for attending the event without police permission.
  • The government has pledged to pay Rs 25 lakh to the family of the deceased and continue to assist the injured child.
  • The Chief Minister condemned the lack of support from other film personalities for the victims.
“I assure that we will do everything possible to save the boy’s life,” said Minister Venkat Reddy regarding the injured child.

The government's actions reflect concern for public safety and a commitment to support families affected by the incident.
newTitle: Telangana Bans Benefit Shows and Actor Theatre Visits Following Stampede Incident

title: Bengaluru Accident: CCTV Footage Shows Container Truck Toppling Over SUV Killing Family In Nelamangala Highway - Oneindia
summary:
Tragic Bengaluru Accident: Container Truck Topples Over SUV, Killing Family

Published: Saturday, December 21, 2024, 21:44 [IST] Source: Oneindia News

A horrific accident on the Bengaluru-Tumakuru highway resulted in the death of six family members, including a notable tech industry leader, when a speeding container truck toppled over their SUV.

  • The victims include Chandram Yegapagol, the Managing Director of IAST Software Solutions, and five family members.
  • The incident occurred near Nelamangala during their journey to Maharashtra for Christmas celebrations.
  • CCTV footage reveals the speeding container lorry losing control and crashing onto the SUV.
  • The tragedy has sparked an outpouring of grief within the tech community and raised concerns about road safety.
“The CCTV footage highlights the container lorry's high speed and sudden loss of control, showcasing the gravity of the incident.”

This tragic event underscores the need for improved traffic safety measures and has left an indelible impact on the affected community.
newTitle: Tragic Bengaluru Accident: Container Truck Topples Over SUV, Killing Family

title: Higher Pension: Employers must submit wage details by January 2025 to get benefits | Mint - Mint
summary:
Higher Pension: Employers Must Submit Wage Details by January 2025 to Get Benefits

Publication Date: N/A Source: Live Mint

The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has extended the deadline for employers to submit wage details for higher pension benefits to January 31, 2025. This extension provides a final opportunity for compliance with recent regulations.

  • The EPFO has highlighted the need for employers to process and upload pending applications for pension validation.
  • Clarifications must be provided by January 15, 2025, for higher pension applications.
  • Over 4.66 lakh cases require additional information to proceed.
  • The deadline for employers was previously extended multiple times since February 2023.
  • 3.1 lakh applications are still pending with employers despite the extensions.
“A final opportunity is being given to the employers till 31.01.2025 to ensure that employers process and upload these pending Applications for Validation of Option / Joint Options.” - EPFO Statement

In conclusion, the EPFO's extension aims to facilitate compliance among employers and ensure that eligible pensioners can benefit from the higher pension scheme.
newTitle: Higher Pension: Employers Must Submit Wage Details by January 2025 to Get Benefits

title: Multi-storey Building Collapses In Punjab's Mohali, Several People Feared Trapped - News18
summary:
Multi-storey Building Collapses In Punjab's Mohali, Several People Feared Trapped

Date: December 22, 2024

Source: News18

A multi-storey building collapsed in Punjab’s Mohali district, leaving several people feared trapped under the debris. Rescue operations are underway, featuring teams from the National Disaster Response Force and local authorities.

  • A multi-storey building in Mohali collapsed, with reports of people trapped inside.
  • Rescue operations commenced promptly, involving local and NDRF teams.
  • Emergency services, including police and fire brigades, are at the scene.
  • The building collapse may be linked to nearby construction activities.
  • Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann is overseeing rescue operations.
“Sad news has been received that a multistorey building near Sohana in Sahibzada Ajit Singh Nagar (Mohali) has collapsed. The entire administration and other rescue teams have been deployed at the spot.” - Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann

The building collapse has raised concerns about safety protocols in construction, and ongoing efforts are focused on locating and rescuing any individuals possibly trapped under the rubble.
newTitle: Multi-storey Building Collapses In Punjab's Mohali, Several People Feared Trapped

title: ‘No treatment to Bangladeshi patients’ — local BJP workers protest outside private hospital in Kolkata - The Indian Express
summary:
‘No treatment to Bangladeshi patients’ — local BJP workers protest outside private hospital in Kolkata

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: The Indian Express

A group of local BJP workers protested against a private hospital in Kolkata, demanding that it refuse treatment to non-Hindu patients from Bangladesh. This protest is part of rising tensions between India and Bangladesh over issues affecting the Hindu minority in the neighboring country.

  • A prominent private hospital in Kolkata announced it would no longer admit Bangladeshi patients.
  • BJP workers launched the ‘Salute Tiranga’ protest platform in response to tensions and alleged atrocities faced by Hindus in Bangladesh.
  • The protesters claim that the treatment should be denied to non-Hindu patients based on national integrity.
  • Another Kolkata hospital has also halted treatment for Bangladeshi patients citing disrespect to the Indian flag.
  • Political tensions are affecting cultural representation, as seen in the absence of Bangladesh at major local fairs.
“Country comes first… our brothers and sisters are being tortured and killed over there. Thus, no medical treatment should be provided to non-Hindu Bangladeshi’s.”

The protests underscore the escalating diplomatic and cultural tensions between India and Bangladesh, reflecting broader issues related to nationalism and minority rights in the region.
newTitle: Protests Erupt in Kolkata Over Treatment of Bangladeshi Patients

title: 55th GST council meeting in Jaisalmer on December 21, 2024: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman media briefing - The Hindu
summary:
55th GST Council Meeting Overview: Key Decisions and Updates

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The 55th meeting of the GST Council, chaired by Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, was held on December 21, 2024, in Jaisalmer. Several significant discussions on GST changes, including those related to insurance levies, were tabled for future consideration.

  • The review of GST levies on life and health insurance policies was postponed.
  • A Group of Ministers will re-examine the insurance levies prior to making recommendations to the Council.
  • Proposals for rate rationalisation involving about 150 items, such as packaged drinking water and bicycles under ₹10,000, were deferred.
  • The GST on gene therapy and long-range surface to air missiles has been exempted from tax.
  • Used car sales GST increased from 12% to 18%.
  • New tax rates were established for different types of popcorn based on packaging.
  • An examination of GST levies by states hit by natural disasters was initiated.
“Gene therapy that is now critical for dealing with life-threatening diseases, so have been totally exempted [from GST].” - Nirmala Sitharaman

This meeting highlights ongoing efforts to adjust the GST framework to better address various economic needs and situations, while many discussions are still pending for clarity and consensus.
newTitle: 55th GST Council Meeting Overview: Key Decisions and Updates

title: Multistorey building collapses in Punjab’s Mohali, several feared trapped - The Hindu
summary:
Multistorey Building Collapse in Mohali Leaving Several Trapped

Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: PTI

Rescue operations are ongoing after a multistorey building collapsed in Sohana village, Mohali, with fears that people are trapped beneath the debris.

  • The incident occurred on December 21, 2024, according to local sources.
  • District authorities have initiated rescue operations, employing two excavators and a National Disaster Response Team (NDRF) has been dispatched to the site.
  • Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann expressed concern and confirmed that rescue efforts are ongoing, urging cooperation from the public.
  • Preliminary reports suggest the building may have collapsed after excavation work was done nearby.
  • Senior police officials are monitoring the rescue operations, emphasizing the urgency of clearing the debris.
“It is an unfortunate incident. Rescue operation is in full swing.” - Kulwant Singh, Mohali MLA

The situation remains critical as authorities work tirelessly to locate and rescue those potentially trapped under the rubble.
newTitle: Multistorey Building Collapse in Mohali Leaving Several Trapped

Building collapses in Punjab's Mohali, several feared trapped - Hindustan Times
summary:
Building Collapses in Punjab's Mohali, Several Feared Trapped

Date: Dec 21, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

A multi-storey building collapsed in Mohali, Punjab, resulting in fears that several individuals may be trapped under the debris. The district authorities have initiated rescue operations with an NDRF team on-site.

  • The building collapsed after a loud noise was reported, possibly linked to excavation work in the area.
  • Two excavators and a fire brigade team have been deployed for rescue efforts.
  • Senior Superintendent of Police Deepak Pareek confirmed the ongoing operation and stated that the cause of the collapse is under investigation.
  • Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann is coordinating with the administration and urged locals to assist the rescue teams.
“We pray that there is no loss of life, we will also take action against the culprits.” - Bhagwant Mann

The situation remains critical as rescue operations continue, with hopes for a safe recovery of those trapped.
newTitle: Building Collapses in Punjab's Mohali, Rescue Operations Underway

title: GST council defers tax cut on insurance premiums as Nirmala Sitharaman awaits IRDAI feedback - Hindustan Times
summary:
GST Council Defers Tax Cut on Insurance Premiums

Date: Dec 21, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Goods and Services Tax (GST) council deferred the decision to cut tax on insurance premiums as many inputs including IRDAI comments are awaited. Additionally, the council clarified taxi regulations on popcorn taxation.

  • The GST council did not approve a tax cut on insurance premiums pending IRDAI feedback.
  • Clarification issued that pre-packed ready-to-eat snacks will face a 12% tax.
  • Tax on caramelised popcorn is set at 18% without changing the existing popcorn tax rate.
  • A group of ministers (GoM) will be formed to address Andhra Pradesh’s demand for a calamity cess on luxury goods.
"The cess will be on luxury items and state-specific levy," said Andhra Pradesh Finance Minister Payyavula Keshav.

This decision reflects ongoing considerations in adapting taxation to address current needs while awaiting further input from key stakeholders.
newTitle: GST Council Defers Insurance Tax Cut; Nirmala Sitharaman Awaits Feedback
